result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Conners was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: AMENDED 05-09-2016:  Credit for time served applied to 15CF326.   AMENDED 05-10-2016:  Credit granted as originally stated as defendant served his time in 15CF326 without additional credit from this file.

miscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care. No contact, directly or indirectly, with co-defendants or victim; JW. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment or attend school full time or a combination of both equal to full time. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 3 years bifurcated sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.
Obtain and maintain full-time, verifiable employment or engage in combination of employment and school equal to full-time hours.

Participate in cognitive intervention programming and other counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate.  Follow through with recommendaitons.  Firearm prohibition warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.
Court costs of $268.00 and DNA surcharge of $250.00 ordered at sentencing July 28, 2015 remain due and owing.

Defendant Michael J Conners in court with attorney Erin Joy Larsen.  Defendant Michael J Conners in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The State is Ch. 950 compliant. Parties have reviewed PSI and disciplinary report. No additions or corrections noted by parties. In 15CF326, the State recommends 6 mos RCJ on each count consec to each other and in 15CF795 State recommends 3 yrs I/S prison equal  bifurcation - 3 yrs probation. Defense asks that the Court sentence deft to 6 mos RCJ in 15CF326 with CFTS and probation in 15CF795.

BTC: 15CF326 - both counts, 6 mos RCJ consec to one another/CFTS, costs DNA costs. These matters may not be expunged.
         15CF795 - both counts, sent w/held - 3 yrs prob
